entry.content:
Welcome to Hanfeng Zhai's page!
________________________________________________________________

  • I am currently a senior student of Theoretical and Applied Mechanics at Shanghai University. I conducted my undergraduate research with Prof. Guohui Hu. I am to join the M.S. in Mechanical Engineering at Cornell University, working with Prof. Jingjie Yeo.

  • I’m currently working on predicting microbubble flow with deep learning as my undergraduate thesis (Chinese preprint), details see BubbleNet, updates available in my notes.

  • For more details, please visit my bio.

  • Curriculum Vitae.

Recent News

________________________________
  • May 21st, 2021: Our work on Inferring micro-bubble dynamics with physics-informed deep learning got featured by arXiv Daily on Twitter.
  • May 17th, 2021: Hanfeng got nominated as Outstanding Graduate of Shanghai, issued by Shanghai Ministry of Education, link for name list.

  • Apr. 20th, 2021: Hanfeng gave a talk at Prof. Zhansheng Guo‘s lab on deep learning applied to mechanics.

  • Feb. 23rd, 2021: Hanfeng served as scientific editor of QbitAI for one month. See articles (1, 2, 3, 4, 5)

  • Feb. 19th, 2021: Hanfeng’s previous Chinese review article on solving PDEs with deep learning got forwarded by Sina Finance, CSDN, etc., etc.

  • Jan. 11th, 2021: Hanfeng gave a talk at the closing ceremony of the academic forum. The Chinese Academy of Engineering academician Sun, Jinliang also sttend the ceremony. See photos. News also covered by Shanghai Education TV, Tencent, SHU, Guangming Daily, Wenhui, etc.

  • Dec. 30th, 2020: Hanfeng delivered a presentation at Shanghai University Undergraduate Academic Forum titled “Computation Methods for Applied Mechanics Problem“ (See my slides, paper, poster). The news are covered by Shanghai University and Baidu. See my Tweets and details.

  • Dec. 7th, 2020: Hanfeng is nominated as Outstanding Student, see SMES News.

  • Nov. 30th, 2020: Hanfeng receives the Shanghai University Academic Scholarship (Top Class) award and Shanghai University Arts and Sports Scholarship. See SHU News.

  • Oct. 21st, 2020: Our poster for The Design of The Lightweight Compressive Interlayer displayed in the hall of SMES as Outstanding Undergraduate Course Project. See picture.

  • Aug. 5th, 2020: Our poster for Design of Intelligent Tuning Equipment for Stringed Instruments is selected as backup poster of Shanghai University for National College Student Innovation Forum. See our poster.

  • Feb. 30th, 2020: Hanfeng delivered a online course for the students of Department of Mechanics as a course project of Theory of Elasticity. Click for backup video.

  • Oct. 28th, 2019: Our poster for The Design of The Lightweight Compressive Interlayer is displayed in the Virtural Simulation Lab at School of Mechanics and Engineering Science. See poster and photo.
